title: The Overwatch League: Statistics For Success
text:
Independent Research supervised by UCLA Faculty
data analytics, October 2024 - current


Reseasrch Title:


AI vs. Legal Experts: Speed and Accuracy in Case Analysis


Research Overview
I am conducting independent research under the mentorship of UCLA faculty, Dr. Vivian Lew, in collaboration with Tranquility-AI Cybersecurity International and Professor Marta D’Elia. My work explores the transformative potential of artificial intelligence in the analysis of legal documents, with a focus on advancing efficiency and accuracy in the fields of criminal justice and public safety.
The research investigates the comparative performance of AI systems and legal professionals in processing complex case materials. Specifically, it examines differences in speed, comprehension, and accuracy when reviewing legal documents and answering associated questions. This includes assessing whether AI can achieve similar or superior levels of performance compared to human expertise, thereby identifying areas where AI could support or complement traditional legal workflows.
Beyond performance metrics, the project addresses broader considerations, such as the ethical and practical implications of integrating AI into legal practices. Key challenges include ensuring fairness and transparency in AI decision-making, maintaining the confidentiality of sensitive information, and understanding how technology can be optimally utilized to support legal professionals without replacing their nuanced judgment and expertise.
This research contributes to the growing intersection of technology, data analytics, and the legal profession by offering insights into how AI can streamline time-intensive processes, enhance productivity, and improve accessibility to justice. Ultimately, the findings aim to inform policy development and guide the adoption of AI-driven solutions in legal and public safety domains, fostering innovation while upholding the principles of fairness and accuracy.

title: Christian Smith
text:
My name is Christian Smith, and I am an upcoming graduate of the UCLA Statistics and Data Science program. I am passionate about leveraging data-driven insights to solve complex problems, particularly in sports analytics, gaming, and human psychology. My projects reflect these interests, as I believe that working with data I am deeply engaged with leads to the most impactful results.
I specialize in applying machine learning models to extract insights and make predictions from large datasets, often requiring extensive data cleaning and preprocessing. With a strong foundation in statistical analysis, I enjoy transforming raw data to be more interpretable, and to seek model improvement.
As I transition into the workforce, I am seeking opportunities where I can contribute to data-driven teams, applying my analytical skills to create meaningful industry impact. With a strong aptitude for leadership, adaptability, and collaboration, I am eager to bring my expertise in statistical methods and machine learning to an organization that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

title: University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA)
text:
Motivation
I chose UCLA not only for its beautiful sceneries and lovely weather, but for its ability to compliment my practical knowledge of implementing machine learning models with the statistical theory behind how they function through its rigorous curriculum. While coding skills can be acquired through online courses, a deep understanding of statistical models requires more than syntax, it demands knowledge of underlying assumptions, limitations, and proper applications. At UCLA, I developed the ability to critically assess and implement models with statistical integrity, ensuring that the insights I generate are both valid and impactful. This strong theoretical foundation, combined with hands-on experience, has prepared me to approach real-world data challenges with confidence and precision.
